Package com.conmuti.conmuti.testrunner

Class DirectoryTestRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.conmuti.conmuti.testrunner.DirectoryTestRunner
  • public class DirectoryTestRunner
extends java.lang.Object
    Runs unit tests found within the user's unit test directory against objects found in the user's class directory

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> classNames

      private UserData userData

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DirectoryTestRunner​(UserData userData)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkClassDirectoryLevel()
      A method which checks if a class file runs within the class directory, If it doesn't then the directory is shortened and the package name is extended until the directory name is shortened to the start of the package and the package name is lengthened to the class' package name
      boolean checkTestDirectoryLevel()
      A method which checks if a test file runs within the test directory, If it doesn't then the directory is shortened and the package name is extended until the directory name is shortened to the start of the package and the package name is lengthened to the class' package name
      int extractClassNames​(java.lang.String directory, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> classNames)
      A method which extracts class names from a directory and stores them as an array list
      int findClassPackage()
      A method which attempts to locate the package name of the implementing classes
      int findTestPackage()
      A method which attempts to locate the package name of the tests
      void initialize()
      A method to initialize the packages and classes
      int runAll()
      A method to run all unit tests against the classes loaded from the class package which includes one mutant class

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • extractClassNames

        public int extractClassNames​(java.lang.String directory,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> classNames)
        A method which extracts class names from a directory and stores them as an array list
        Parameters:
        directory - - the directory in which to look for classes
        classNames - - the arraylist which shall contain the class names
        Returns:

      • findClassPackage

        public int findClassPackage()
        A method which attempts to locate the package name of the implementing classes
        Returns:
        - 0 if successful, non-zero otherwise

      • findTestPackage

        public int findTestPackage()
        A method which attempts to locate the package name of the tests
        Returns:
        - 0 if successful, non-zero otherwise

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        A method to initialize the packages and classes

      • checkClassDirectoryLevel

        public boolean checkClassDirectoryLevel()
        A method which checks if a class file runs within the class directory, If it doesn't then the directory is shortened and the package name is extended until the directory name is shortened to the start of the package and the package name is lengthened to the class' package name
        Returns:
        - true if successful, false if unsuccessful

      • checkTestDirectoryLevel

        public boolean checkTestDirectoryLevel()
        A method which checks if a test file runs within the test directory, If it doesn't then the directory is shortened and the package name is extended until the directory name is shortened to the start of the package and the package name is lengthened to the class' package name
        Returns:
        - true if successful, false if unsuccessful

      • runAll

        public int runAll()
        A method to run all unit tests against the classes loaded from the class package which includes one mutant class
        Returns:
        - 0 if the mutant is not killed, 1 if the mutant is killed
